Exaggerate: The claim of "We've started building the wall" at the Mexico border is an exaggeration because the actual construction is limited to replacement barriers and some fencing, not a full-fledged wall.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent of the construction by implying that a significant portion of the wall has been built, when in reality, it is only a small fraction of the overall project.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide concrete evidence or specific details about the progress made in building the wall.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the replacement barriers and fencing can be equated to the wall promised by President Trump, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists that the construction mentioned in the claim is not representative of the wall that was promised, as it involves replacing existing barriers rather than building new ones.
